scenario:
DemandScience, a global B2B revenue marketing company, has appointed Derek Schoettle as Chairman and CEO, and Ned Leutz as President. This strategic move strengthens DemandScience's leadership team and positions the company for continued growth and innovation. 

As Chairman and CEO, Derek Schoettle will lead the overall strategy and direction of DemandScience. He has extensive experience in leading and scaling B2B organizations, having previously served as CEO of ZoomInfo, GM of IBM Watson & Cloud Data Division, and Chairman of Dealfront. 

As President, Ned Leutz will oversee every aspect of the customer journey, including marketing, sales, customer experience, professional services, and lead fulfillment. He has a proven track record in driving revenue growth, having previously served as Go-To-Market Lead at Great Hill Partners and VP of Emerging Products and VP of Sales-Retention and Growth for ZoomInfo.

The appointments come on the heels of November's news that Terminus, a leading account-centric platform for revenue growth, merged into DemandScience. The combination of DemandScience and Terminus creates a global leader in B2B revenue marketing, delivering a next-generation Account-Based Experience (ABX) platform with omnichannel solutions.

Key features of the combined platform include:

- Accelerating lead generation and pipeline velocity by targeting the right accounts with precision using AI-powered account selection and predictive analytics.
- Identifying, qualifying, and nurturing high-value leads with precision through hyper-personalized campaigns and seamless lead-to-sales handoffs.
- Seamlessly coordinating with sales to close deals faster by providing a unified view of customer interactions and enabling efficient lead management.
- Gaining unified insights and optimizing performance across all channels with centralized data analysis and reporting.
- Operating with confidence, knowing data protocols support compliance with global data protection regulations.

DemandScience has a strong partnership with Adobe, with Lorena Fortuna, Principal Marketing Manager at Adobe, stating that the merger between DemandScience and Terminus is an exciting step forward, empowering marketers and sellers to engage the full buyer journey and capture both revenue and market share.
